timeline.bodyText: There is a method in Path to get the last element.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: coerce into val.getClass().  We probably want to support lists of numbers too.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: Object val will be an instance of Collection. To get the parameterized type of collection, I think we need to iterate over the path and get paremeterizedType from entityDict. I am not sure how to get parameterized type from Collection object
replies.author: Chandrasekar-Rajasekar

replies.bodyText:
You are right, we'll need to iterate over it.
Another alternative is to convert field into a Path object in Elide.  That will do all the type conversion for you.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: This check seems redundant with the validation logic below.  Do we also need this check?
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText:
This check is for Global Filter. The validation logic below is for the typed filter. Previously we did not have toMany relationship check for global filter. So I decided to include only Iscollection check for global filter.
Without this check in global filter, we allow filter expr like book?filter=title=hasmember='1' to pass through and jpql rejects these statement.
replies.author: Chandrasekar-Rajasekar

timeline.bodyText: Can we remove the local variable here?
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: There is a much cleaner way to do these comparisons with hamcrest Matchers.  There are some good examples in PaginationIT.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.message: Allow memberof operation for only attributes and collection types

timeline.bodyText:
Can we rename this method to something more specific about what it's checking?
How about isLastPathElementAssignableFrom
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: We still need to fix the coercion.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Can we also add error tests for book.authors and book.publisher?
